intro: Stenostephanus longistaminus var. longistaminus, commonly known as the long-stamen stephanus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces long, slender stamens that are a distinctive feature of the species. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. The flowers are primarily pollinated by birds, particularly sunbirds, making it an important plant in local ecosystems.
